h1: Ireland Contractor Salary Calculator – Freelance & Contractor Pay
metaTitle: Ireland Contractor Salary Calculator | Freelance Pay Calculator
metaDescription: Calculate contractor pay in Ireland including Ltd company vs umbrella options, tax deductions, and take-home earnings.
intro: Calculate your earnings as a contractor or freelancer in Ireland with our specialized calculator. Ireland offers contractors two main options: operating through a limited company (Ltd) or using an umbrella company. Each option has different tax implications, deductions, and administrative requirements. This calculator helps you compare both approaches to find the most tax-efficient structure for your contracting work.
howContractorCalculatorWorks: This Ireland contractor calculator compares two common contracting structures: Ltd company and umbrella company. For Ltd companies, it calculates corporation tax, director's salary, and dividends. For umbrella companies, it calculates PAYE tax, PRSI, and USC. The calculator shows net take-home pay for both options, helping you choose the most suitable structure based on your working patterns and tax situation.

example1.title: Ltd Company Contractor
example1.scenario: Contractor earning €400/day, working 20 days/month through Ltd company

faqs.question: What's the difference between Ltd and umbrella companies?
faqs.answer: Ltd companies are your own limited company where you invoice clients and pay corporation tax. Umbrella companies employ you and handle tax/PAYE deductions, but take a margin for their services.

faqs.question: Which option is more tax-efficient?
faqs.answer: Ltd companies are often more tax-efficient for higher earners due to lower effective tax rates on dividends. Umbrella companies may be simpler for occasional contractors.

faqs.question: What are the costs of running an Ltd company?
faqs.answer: Annual costs include accounting fees (€1,200-2,000), registered office (€300-600), and corporation tax filing. Umbrella companies charge 5-8% margin.

faqs.question: Do I need to register for VAT?
faqs.answer: If your annual turnover exceeds €75,000, you must register for VAT. Umbrella companies handle this automatically.

faqs.question: Can I claim expenses as a contractor?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can claim legitimate business expenses like travel, equipment, and home office costs. Keep detailed records and receipts.

conclusion: Choosing between Ltd and umbrella company structures in Ireland depends on your working patterns, tax situation, and administrative preferences. Our calculator provides a clear comparison of both options, helping you make an informed decision about your contracting setup. Consider consulting a tax advisor to ensure compliance with Irish tax laws and to optimize your tax efficiency.
disclaimer: SalaryWise provides general guidance on contractor structures. Tax treatment varies based on individual circumstances. Consult a qualified tax advisor for personalized advice.
